Another useful identification method is Xenodiagnosis, or the <a3_0><b8_0>use of a vector to support the growth of an infectious agent<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Chagas disease is the most significant example, because it is difficult to directly demonstrate the presence of <a4_0><b9_0>the causative agent<b9_0/><a4_0/>, Trypanosoma cruzi in a patient, which therefore makes it difficult to definitively make a diagnosis.
